data.title: Heath Ledger & Michelle Williams
data.meta_description: Seems they have got engaged and Michelle is pregnant with Heath's child. Opps story reported here on the 10th.
data.text:
He should have stayed with Naomi Watts.

She was born in the same hospital as me, so that should make her special enough to marry :rolleyes:

0

Eva Leigh wrote:

He should have stayed with Naomi Watts.

She was born in the same hospital as me, so that should make her special enough to marry :rolleyes:

Hmm tell me about it, I like Naomi Watts too, that Heath bloke is so annoying. :mad:

I just hope he treats Michelle right, the way she looks at him in the photo at the 'Brothers Grim' premiere, you can tell she is in love.

0

mrfreeze wrote:

Hmm tell me about it, I like Naomi Watts too, that Heath bloke is so annoying. :mad:

I just hope he treats Michelle right, the way she looks at him in the photo at the 'Brothers Grim' premiere, you can tell she is in love.

Allegedly Naomi Watts left Heath Ledger because he was reluctant to have kids. She's in her mid 30s and think he's a bit younger. He immediately stated going out with Michelle Williams who has gotten pregnant very quickly so I hope that Michelle isn't heading for heartbreak

I wonder how Naomi Watts feels about it?

0

Laurat wrote:

Allegedly Naomi Watts left Heath Ledger because he was reluctant to have kids. She's in her mid 30s and think he's a bit younger. He immediately stated going out with Michelle Williams who has gotten pregnant very quickly so I hope that Michelle isn't heading for heartbreak

I wonder how Naomi Watts feels about it?

I can't believe Michelle would get pregnant without being in a long term relationship, I thought she was stronger than that.

She seems to be searching for a father figure, but that could be just my interpretation. Ledger seems like such a 'rat' I hope it does work out but I can see him cheating on her later on.

Naomi had a lucky escape if you ask me, she can do better than him.

I'm not jealous BTW

0

Why all the fuss? He got to snog Jake Gyllenhaal in Broke Back Mountain. If his partner's are finding his philandering a problem, I would have been glad to deputise in this instance.

0

I have to say that I agree with the poster who said they saw heartbreak for Michelle in this one. I can't see Heath staying faithful to her.

0

GrannyMatrix wrote:

Hmmm...wonder what the f*ck his/her problem is...

whoops, stopped wondering. Nay mind.

Well possibly the only time in my life I've seen this expression 'Straw man argument' used with any degree of solemnity is on this forum. It has become a meme throughout the forum and now basically lots of people use it to discredit an argument.

0

mrfreeze wrote:

I can't believe Michelle would get pregnant without being in a long term relationship, I thought she was stronger than that.

She seems to be searching for a father figure, but that could be just my interpretation. Ledger seems like such a 'rat' I hope it does work out but I can see him cheating on her later on.

Naomi had a lucky escape if you ask me, she can do better than him.

I'm not jealous BTW

Nothing wrong with having a baby and not being in a long term relationship, i was with my boyfriend 3 months when i fell pregnant. Was the best thing that happened to us!

0

sticki-vicki wrote:

Nothing wrong with having a baby and not being in a long term relationship, i was with my boyfriend 3 months when i fell pregnant. Was the best thing that happened to us!

OH please, since when has getting knocked up after only being with someone a short time been an admirable quality?

It might have worked for you, and I hope it works for Michelle, but I don't trust Ledger, like I didn't trust Jeff and Jades 'relationship' to last.

I expected better of Michelle, she seemed to have a good head on her shoulders.

0

Not admirable but it happens, just beacuse she fell pregnant doesn't make her stupid/weak/and less of a woman.

Things happen and they all happen for a reason!

0

mrfreeze wrote:

There was no argument there to discredit, that's why it's a 'straw man' doh :rolleyes:

Yes but you're acting like we're in debating society or something - when in fact we're on some internet showbiz forum discussing some zelebrity actress who's got a bun int he oven. I mean ffs, it's hardly the sort of discussion that merits any philosophical thought processes is it? It's just a bit of bloody fun!

0

sticki-vicki wrote:

Not admirable but it happens, just beacuse she fell pregnant doesn't make her stupid/weak/and less of a woman.

Things happen and they all happen for a reason!

Yeah like not using contraception when you have sex.

And just because I said 'I thought she was stronger' doesn't mean I think she is weak, again with the 'straw men'.

0
